elements.title: climate change in Uganda
elements.contents: ... that the Rwenzori glaciers (examples pictured) are being melted by climate change in Uganda?

elements.title: Edward A. Synan
elements.contents: ... that Edward A. Synan, a military chaplain, wrote over eighty journal articles on subjects ranging from early patristics to late scholasticism?

elements.title: A.C. Monza
elements.contents: ... that Italian football club A.C. Monza played 40 seasons in Serie B before securing promotion to Serie A – more than any other club?

elements.title: Red Jordan Arobateau
elements.contents: ... that Red Jordan Arobateau adopted "Red" as his first name after dyeing his hair red because he thought the color represented sensuality and eroticism of his work?

elements.title: Bohr's law
elements.contents: ... that according to Bohr's law, the person who draws first in a gunfight loses?

elements.title: Richmond station
elements.contents: ... that Richmond station includes a "rather disquieting" artwork by William Mitchell?

elements.title: Kwaku Ohene-Frempong
elements.contents: ... that Kwaku Ohene-Frempong, an expert in sickle cell disease, decided while still in medical school to devote his life to the study of the disease, after his newborn son was diagnosed with the condition?

elements.title: a Nevada radio station named "Sexy"
elements.contents: ... that a Nevada radio station named "Sexy" blew into town with a windstorm?
